title: Team Dynamics Knowledge
description: Understanding and facilitating healthy team dynamics grounded in Axiom 0

axiom_zero_foundation.statement: All being and doing is grounded in love and trust
team_implications: Trust that every team member wants the project to succeed
Assume disagreements come from different perspectives, not ill intent
Create space for vulnerability - it's the foundation of real collaboration

forming.description: Team is new, members are polite and uncertain

workshop_adaptations.vision_quest: Emphasize that all ideas are welcome, use pair work before plenary
workshop_adaptations.ethics_arena: Start with lighter dilemmas, build to harder ones

storming.description: Team members assert themselves, conflicts emerge

workshop_adaptations.ethics_arena: Perfect workshop for this stage - channel conflict into productive debate
workshop_adaptations.stack_safari: Use Trade-Off Tetris to make competing priorities visible

norming.description: Team develops shared norms and cohesion
facilitation_approach: Create artifacts that embody shared identity

workshop_adaptations.agent_assembly: Great for norming - creates shared characters and language

performing.description: Team is highly effective and autonomous
facilitation_approach: Step back and let team lead

workshop_adaptations.all: Can run workshops with lighter facilitation, team self-manages

psychological_safety.definition: Belief that one won't be punished or humiliated for speaking up with ideas, questions, concerns, or mistakes
psychological_safety.importance: Without psychological safety, creative games and honest discussions fail

building_safety.example: Share your own uncertainties and mistakes
Thank people for sharing, even imperfect ideas

building_safety.action: Acknowledge the risk of speaking up
building_safety.example: That took courage to share, thank you

building_safety.action: Separate idea critique from personal criticism
building_safety.example: I see the challenge with this approach (not 'that's a bad idea')
I'd especially like to hear from people who haven't spoken yet

safety_check.question: On a scale of 1-10, how safe do you feel sharing your honest opinions right now?

response_threshold.average_below_7: Pause and address - something is blocking safety
response_threshold.wide_variance: Some feel safe, others don't - check in individually

healthy_patterns.name: Yes, And
healthy_patterns.description: Build on others' ideas instead of replacing
healthy_patterns.example: I love that, and what if we also...

healthy_patterns.name: Steel Manning
healthy_patterns.description: Represent opposing views at their strongest
healthy_patterns.example: The best argument for that position is...

healthy_patterns.name: Curious Questions
healthy_patterns.description: Ask to understand, not to challenge
healthy_patterns.example: Help me understand - what led you to that?

healthy_patterns.name: Explicit Appreciation
healthy_patterns.description: Name what you value in contributions
healthy_patterns.example: I appreciate you raising that concern because...

patterns_to_redirect.name: Yes, But
patterns_to_redirect.redirect: Can you find one thing you agree with first?

patterns_to_redirect.name: Monologuing
patterns_to_redirect.redirect: Great points - let's hear from others

patterns_to_redirect.name: Side Conversations
patterns_to_redirect.redirect: Let's bring that to the group

value_of_diversity: Inclusion models the ethics we espouse

inclusion_practices.description: Verbal, written, visual options for contribution
inclusion_practices.why: Introverts and different communication styles included

inclusion_practices.description: Pause before discussion for individual reflection
inclusion_practices.why: Not everyone thinks best out loud

inclusion_practices.description: Some polls and submissions without names
inclusion_practices.why: Reduces social pressure on minority views

inclusion_practices.description: Periodically ask if everyone feels heard

watching_for: Whose ideas get built upon vs. dropped?

adaptations.solution: Use chat, breakouts, and structured turns
Shorter sessions, more breaks, movement prompts
Informal chat time, virtual coffee, personal check-ins

async_collaboration.when: Team across time zones, or when deep thinking helps
async_collaboration.tools: Shared docs, comment threads, recorded videos

conflict_transformation.step_1: Pause and breathe - return to Axiom 0
conflict_transformation.step_2: Acknowledge emotions - 'I hear this matters deeply'
conflict_transformation.step_3: Clarify positions - 'Help me understand what you need'
conflict_transformation.step_4: Find shared ground - 'What do you both agree on?'
conflict_transformation.step_5: Generate options - 'What solutions might work for both?'
conflict_transformation.step_6: Choose and commit - 'Let's try this and check in'

low_energy_focused.action: This is fine - don't force energy

low_energy_disengaged.action: Take a break, change format, check in individually
